review: When you travel a lot, you will find some places that will match your needs! TGI Fridays is one of them. I was two day ago in another TGI Fridays next to Philadelphia and I got the same satisfaction. Wonderful ribs, good beer, faster service and sports TVs.

My daughter chose this spot on a mommy daughter lunch date.. she had looked at the menu online and knew just what she wanted.. My daughter ordered the loaded potato skins and I ordered the Cobb salad. Both were terrible. The potato skins were under cooked and hard like a raw potato.  The lettuce in the salad was wilted and slimy.  We only took a few bites and mentioned both issues to our waitress who was so overwhelmed that she said she would be right back and NEVER did. I asked another server for our waitress or our check... neither showed up in 10 minutes so we walked out and went to Wahoos for lunch. I hope this places closes soon and is replaced with a yummy and great service oriented restaurant.

If I could give less than a one star, I would. We went at 11am for an early lunch.  Two other tables (totaling six customers) were seated in this restaurant. Our waitress came over and we placed our drink order (water, she asked us if we wanted lemon--we said no lemon) and an order of mozzarella sticks. When she brought us our drinks, they had lemons--no biggie, we just pick them out. She then says, which appetizer did you want loaded potato skins or something else. We wanted neither, only the mozz sticks.  We had our menus closed, on the edge of the table for 10+ minutes. Our waitress went passed us to give another table their drinks and get their food order. She walked passed us again, spent 5+ minutes entering the info into the computer. She never came back to our table, so we left.  This kind of service educated me as to why the other Friday's have closed. I will not be back to this one, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Came in for lunch during work hours.  Arrive at 12:35.  Others seated after us and who ordered after us were served.  We were told 4 times our food would be out.  At 1:20 when we were told again it would be up soon, we said no and left.  Lunch at Del Taco was great.  Absolutely unacceptable.  July 26:  still not a peep from them.

We visited at about 1:30 on a Sunday, where there is happy hour in the bar all day. It was about half capacity, and only one server was in the bar. It took 15 minutes to put our drink order in.  We ordered nachos and several appetizers with drinks, and unfortunately our nachos came out cold and soggy. There is a dip that I believe is supposed to be melted queso, but had more of the consistency of Campbell's mushroom soup straight from the can. The drinks were great, but I noticed a guest from another table had to chase down a server that was tossing towels in the air like it was a pizza instead of taking care of his guests to attain refills. You'd have better luck at the Del Taco right next door.

Location:  Good location right off of the road. Easy to get to and park.  Service:  I have only gotten carry out from here so not sure on the overall service but when I order at the bar the staff their has been nice and promote.  Food:  It's your topical restaurant chain food. Nothing special but nothing overwhelming great.   Cleanliness:  Again I have only gotten items to go so I have not stayed long. When I have been in the restaurant it's been mostly clean.

This location not only looks great, but the staff was friendly and frequently checked on us. The manager even greeted us as we were eating to make sure everything was going good. Honestly can't ask for much more

We came in for desert and water.  This should have been an easy service and tip for our waitress but NO! TGI Friday's only had one job, cut a piece of cheesecake and cut a brownie. I'm not sure why I received warm brownie soup dough with Carmel and ice cream.  When my husband finally interrupted our waitress from chatting with her co-worker to take the mud-pie back, she indicated she "didn't know" what was on my plate. I asked for cheesecake instead and had to wait 20 minutes to get that. There were only 4 people in the restaurant so I'm sure they were "slammed" in the kitchen. Then TGI Friday's had the mitigated gall to charge me for the sludge with ice cream telling me that it was fine for me to eat!! Needless to say I didn't pay for that mess only the cheesecake we ordered. No tip for chatty Cathy either. Won't be back!!

The absolute worst service I've ever had in Stapleton. I've been to this location over a dozen times since it is close to my house.  The service has never been great but recently it has gotten worse. I waited for over 25 minutes and never received my drink order, let alone a menu. The restaurant was not busy, and the wait staff all acted liked we were an inconvenience. I will not be going back.
We came in around 10pm. Drinks were great, service was friendly. We each did the endless apps and they were awesome! No idea why everyone else has a sour taste about this location.

Server and host were nice.  Food and drinks took agesss.  Bartenders let some guy at the bar change the tv to MSNBC and I was forced to watch a documentary about inmates while waiting forever for my food.  Don't stop here if you're in a hurry.

We waited for 40 min to be seated in a half empty restaurant. Granted we had a party of 10, but we're told it would be a 10 minute wait. Unbelievably the hostess would not give us a menu to look at while we waited ???Our server was nice but inexperienced. I'm currently writing this review while waiting for our meal, they are bringing out 2 meals every 5 minutes. Ended up being 20 minutes between the first and last meals being brought to table.  Horrible service, food is good but not good enough to make up for the sevice.

They must have seen all the horrible reviews on here and stepped up their game! I walked in here on a Monday around 5pm, had a really great experience! PROs: - My server thought that I was waiting too long and gave me an appetizer for free. I think I only waited for 5 min after being seated. - This appears to be a brand new restaurant, everything was clean and new. - Location is great! I am staying at the hotel across the street. I realize that not everyone is staying across the street, but the location overall seems very easy to get to.  - The beer was fresh, I can tell that they keep the keg lines clean. CONs: - I can't think of anything really looming for this place. I never really liked the menu for Fridays, it all seems really over priced for what it is.  - There is no local beer selection despite saying so on the menu. Summary:  This was a good experience. If I stayed at this hotel again, I would come here again.

It was seriously just meh...  Really no other way to explain it.  We found a table in the bar late on a Friday night.  Waitress stopped right away with menus....  Then gone for about 10 minutes.  So we ordered our drinks, appitizer and dinner all at once.  Waitress was very upfront about the lack of appearance with the meal my boyfriend wanted.  Drinks seem to take forever...  Not the bartenders fault.  Finally got our drinks and app....  Another 15-20 minutes before she stopped back to let us know our dinner would be up in a few minutes....  (This was the last time our waitress talked to us until after our meal.)  By then it had been 30+ minutes since we ordered... Yes they were a bit busy but seemed to have full staff....  5 or so minutes later here comes our measly looking meals...  Bourbon chicken...  looked just pathetic!  My burger was just ok.  Cooked just the way I requested.  Our waitress never stopped to see if we would like a refill..... NOTHING...   She wasn't rude but she sure wasn't pleasant.  And sadly we are not likely to return to this location.
There's no organization. The servers seemed overwhelmed and short staffed. Food isn't brought out together and takes forever to get our drinks....

The food is what you would expect from restaurants in this group/category.  What will make or break your experience will be the staff.  Some staff are very kind and helpful.  Others are rude and seem to hate their job.  I have had waiters that were very kind, helpful, joyful, etc.  I've also interacted with hostesses that have been friendly, even when clearly overworked.   With that said, other hostesses have been rude and indifferent.  Recently I called and was ignored.  The phone rang for several minutes.  Thinking they may just be busy, I tried several minutes later only to experience the same problem.  Internet third time calling I spoke with the front desk hostess.  She was rude from the very start.  Even her "greeting" was robotic, giving the impression she hated her job.  When asked a simple question her response was "well you can come in and see."  She didn't put in even the slightest effort.   While you can have a good experience, interactions like these will be common place and ruin your night.  When I'm paying for dinner out, I don't want to risk a hostess ruining my night.   I won't be going back to this location...but will to others locations with better service since I love the wings.

Worst service, we sat down ordered a beer. Took her 20 minutes of tell us they didn't have beer, asking the bartender in front of us because she saw us and remembered. She took 3 other orders and as well as food and brought them out before us of drinks.  Horrible experience I will never be coming to this location

The last time I was in here the 10$ unlimited appetizer deal has just been implemented and it seemed like the place was packed with everyone cashing in on the deal! Our waitress, the bartenders, other staff and most importantly the kitchen crew were apparently very overwhelmed and seemed to be running waaaay behind on orders the entire time!!! At one point we ordered drinks and didn't see our waitress again for 30 minutes before we could order food and our drinks still hadn't reached our table by the time she returned. She kept getting confused on who she had seen and who she hadn't and who needed what and who was at one point in their meal so she just gave up and went to the back and started going off to another waitress about the kitchen being so behind! It was a mess! By the end of our time she came over and was very apologetic about the display of chaos in the building and sent us out with 5 boxes of appetizers and the rest of our unfinished meals! It was nice that she was trying to make up for the poor service with food for free and not being charged the drinks on our bill but by then we were convinced that we shouldn't come back! This was the worst I've seen this location but it's just a fact that every time we came here the food was off and the service mediocre so all in all we tried to love you Friday's but it's just not working out!

I will never go to Fridays at Northfield again!!  The last time I went here, the service was awful and SLOW! Gave it another shot tonight, and it was still ridiculously slow. We went early, and there were less than ten tables with customers. We ordered three salads and a cup of soup. After 50 minutes, we walked out when our server informed us the salads still were not ready. I find it comical that on their website they indicate that Friday's is a great place for a "quick bite", yet the majority of reviews complain about how long it takes to get service and/or food. Do NOT go to Fridays at Northfield unless you have unlimited time to wait for your food.

TGIF is Great for groups and has affordable Options for HH, a quick dinner and assortments of appetizers to share as a group. I usually come to this location with a large group of friends from about 7-15 people. It's a quick & affordable bite before a movie or even a quick meal before heading to the airport. We all live near Northfield so this is a convenient location with lots of parking. Service is often pretty good. They also have some quality drinks and cocktails. This is not my fave place to dine but it def is great for group dining and there is something for everyone. I usually get a steak and veggies or a salad. Tonight I tried to get something different and got their $7 pasta. They have an option for 474,  $4 appetizers, $7 entree (smaller portions), and $4 dessert options. I had the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. It was good but nothing I'd crave. I do enjoy their fried green bean app for only $4 and the soft pretzels with cheese!

TGI Fridays is my favorite place to go. My sister, husband and I went there tonight for our 28th wedding anniversary and we had the most amazing service. Jordan was our waiter and Lea was the manager. They made us feel so special and welcomed. We can't wait to go back tomorrow for Father's Day! We appreciate you Jordan and Lea, Thank you for such wonderful customer service!

Always have a great time while I'm here the bartenders always keep your glass full and talk to you like they're your good friend I love coming here and would recommend to all of my friends ask for Corey and Daniel

This restaurant needs to hire a new host ASAP. I walked in with a party of five and a newborn.. From the moment we walked in we were treated with disrespect. The young lady at the desk put her foot out to try and trip a child because they ran in.  Secondly we did not get greeted if she just stared at us and I told her we are here to eat. She looked at me and said "for how many" I told her just us pointing to my party she said "well how many is that" but she said it so freaking rude. Then She said well "we're really busy right now there is no table for you guys" I asked her how long is the wait, she replied "I don't know, you really want me to sit you guys"? And she was very rude with that comment. I honestly feel like she was being rude for no reason. She didn't look around for seats she just told us it was going to be an hour. I'm not sure what the problem was here but the manager was just as a appalled as I was. She said they would take care of me on my next visit, I don't really care about that this place needs to have either better training or more friendly staff because the way we were treated was unfair and totally uncalled for I will not visit this place anymore. A little friendly customer service and perhaps someone more mature will help the situation. Not a 16 or 17-year-old girl with no manners and a disgusting attitude. PS. I did not eat here I took my service somewhere else where it was appreciated!!

This is the worst food! Don't even waste your time. Hadn't been to a Friday's in years and would never go back! I order the grilled chicken Cesar salad which I figured you couldn't really mess up. The chicken was disgusting. It was clearly the fake grilled Tyson chicken that is mushy and gross! Disgusting!!
Service and food was very good. Richard the manager was extremely helpful in researching my point credit. Very much appreciated

I have been to other TGI Fridays and they were great, so i thought this was a sure deal.  I WAS WRONG!! This location is a crap show.  I sat they're for 10 min and we were about to leave when RICHARD stepped up and did a fabulous job!! He was cleaning and clearing his own tables to help those who were waiting but also kept his section full.  Which means more tips and money for him I spoke With Steve the manager and he was very receptive and listened.  I don't know if i would come back to this location, but i love the franchise and will go to others.

We always have a problem when we come to this restaurant, but we tried again, tonight. All I'm saying is, we should have went to Applebee's. They only had one server and one cook. We ordered the endless appetizers and when we FINALLY got them they were cold. We never got refills that we asked for several times. I actually went to the bar and got refills from the bartender.... actually the bartender got our boxes and let the server know we wanted our check.... geesh! Note: don't make the same mistake, go somewhere else!!

Honestly service was below sub par, ordered a lunch special and food came out Luke warm. Server was not prompt on taking order. Quality of service was decent but overall vibes was below. Wouldn't recommend if visiting Denver.

Do not recommend. We ordered the $10 endless appetizers. Some seriously delicious options! You can order one of each at a time. What a super deal after shopping all day in the mall area. I ordered pot stickers and meatballs. The other ladies ordered wings, mozzarella sticks, nachos and potato skins. The potstickers where good. The meatballs were cold. The boneless wings had an odd texture like gristle and fat combined. The nachos never came out and the potato skins where tough-unedible. We tried to make the best of it and order some other options. After 20 minutes of waiting our 2nd order come out. The potstickers this time were drenched in oil and the jack daniels wings were awful tasting. We enjoyed the company and the conversations so it wasnt a damper on our evening. We all decided this deal just wasn't for us and we will order from the menu next time. We asked to speak with the manager but he never came to our table. We settled up, paid out bill and went our way. I later noticed my account had been charged $60 over my bill. No big deal-just call and get an explanation. Everyone at my table but me paid in cash. I spoke with the manager Rob. He was horribly rude. I am glad he didnt come to our table with this awful attitude. His tone was impatient. He cut me off mid sentence to tell me 'thats a lie' because they haven't downloaded credit cards for the night. I was told it was a hold on my card thru my credit card company the issue wasn't with theirs. I explained it wasnt a 'pending' action it was an actual charge. He said he didnt know and couldn't help and hung up. It was his tone and the horrible manner in how he handled the situation that caused the entire evening to sour. The host and our waiter were fantastic. The food was horrible. The time frame it took to get our food. Horrible. We didn't receiver refills on our drinks despite asking several times. This all would warrant a 3 star or I would try the location on another day and time. However, the managers lack of tact, unprofessionalism, the disrespectful tone, and the disgusting customer service from THE MANAGER for the evening is the major reason I do NOT recommend this location and give a one star. We all have bad days but to take it out on the consumer is seriously inappropriate.

Waited about 20 min before a server even came to the table. Food took forever and was cold and bland. Server was very friendly but definitely not meant for the service industry. Had to waive her down after we finished all our food. She dropped it off and never checked back. Not a fun place to spend your Friday night.

Horrible service! I will never come back! I order appetizer there was no side plates no napkins we needed refills in our drinks, needless to say our burgers took almost 50 min ro arrive! Do not recommend

Why, oh why, do people choose to eat at sub-standard chains?  I had no choice in my dining selection, but I wanted to have an open mind.   Service is 5 stars.  Our server was so very nice.   The menu is large, which, to me, means you can't execute anything properly.  I had the mahi mahi with mashed potatoes (no cheese) and fresh spinach (thinking it would be like a salad).  The plate came with a large portion of very dry, over-cooked, and under-seasoned fish.  The potatoes came with ALL of the cheese.  The spinach was sauteed into limp submission and topped with parmesan cheese.  I politely said that I ordered without cheese.  Our server apologized and made it right, which is why service merits 5 stars.  When she returned with the side dishes, the potatoes still had cheese on them.  They were not appetizing anyway, so I just didn't eat them.  The sauteed spinach was not tasty either.   Disappointing dinner.  Seriously, people, seek out local restaurants where the chefs are allowed to source good food and be more creative.

We came for the 10 dollar rack of ribs, so we ordered 2 ribs and when the bill came out to 45 after we talked to our server they took off 10 should have been 25 ish. So becareful of this scam.  Add: after contacting corporate, Alejandro contacted me about my situation and had us come in again. Great atmosphere and food.

Came here for lunch after searching for a while for someone who offers a gluten free bun for their burgers. Served by a great waitress named Brittany who was very attentive to my table constantly making sure my drink was full and checking to see if I needed anything. Burger was cooked well and came out in a short amount of time. Very pleased today.
Slow service. Ordered soup & it was barely warm. Waited forever for server to realize there was a problem. Won't be back.
Horrible service. Second time we sat for over 10 minutes without someone coming to our table ...we left. Tonight was daughters 12 birthday and she was sad we had to leave.

Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday (her choice! I'm guessing it was the least-undesirable out of the Stapleton chains). We had a group of about 12, with an advance reservation put in. While it was a Tuesday night, and business wasn't particularly busy, our service was very, very slow. From the time we sat down to getting orders placed to food on the table, I'd say it took about an hour. That's just sad. On the plus side, once our food finally came out, guests who ordered the endless appetizers were served at a much more respectable pace. Our waitress was friendly enough and did her best, with check ups at the table regularly. Overall- I won't be frequenting this location voluntarily anytime soon.

I had an exceptional happy hour today with the bar staff at this location. I'll be the first to admit I'm typically a Denver foodie that doesn't frequent chains. However: everything top to bottom was great here today.  The individual who put it over the top was the bartender Lowery. If you get sit with this gentleman for a while you'll really enjoy the hospitality and superb service. Pays attention to details, very welcoming, and fast. I was impressed. Lowery @ Northfield. Nicely done. If you're needing a bite don't count them out. Good people and kitchen did well also.

I rarely take the time to write reviews, but this location is quite the negative brand representation of TGIF. On April 8th, 2017, we arrived that the TGIF location in Stapleton, CO. We sat down at our table at 6:40pm. We waited patiently as 10 minutes passed. The restaurant was not busy, but we gave them the benefit of the doubt that something may have come up. At 6:50pm, we were a bit frustrated at the lack of service, and noticed another table of 4 ladies got so frustrated that they got up to leave. Finally, at 7:00pm, we got up to leave as well after waiting 20 minutes for a server to take our drink order. Allow me to remind you that the restaurant was not busy. We asked to speak with the manager to inform him of the poor service. He did not seem to care and appeared to be in favor of the "poor service" culture. We live next to this location and visit at least once a week. The service has always been bad, and that can be seen by the very low ratings on Yelp, Facebook and Google. However, this experience was the cherry on top, and we will no longer be visiting any TGIF location. The male manager with pierced ears was not genuine and did nothing to save the consumer relationship. If you happen to be here, and this manager is on duty, I would avoid speaking with him. When someone comes into your restaurant once a week, the least he could have done would have been to express sincere apology. I would encourage you to read the reviews for this location on Google and Yelp. The reviews are powerful and are clear that this location is not consistent with brand standard.  It is sad that this location will probably face no real consequences of how they treat loyal customers, but sharing this negative experience with you is worth a shot.

My boyfriend and I usually love our TGIFridays back in our town, so we were excited to see one here so close to our hotel. Once he got back to the hotel my salad was missing key ingredients that made it an entree and there was no dressing for my salad. His meal was supposed to have extra jack Daniels sauce and there wasn't any which made his chicken taste dry. All in all we were just happy to have a nice hot dinner but after driving 12 hours just wish we had gotten all of what we ordered and paid for.

The staff makes very little effort. We used to come here every time we were in Denver, but this last year that we've come they don't show any interest in serving you. A host actually had to be prompted to seat us, and although we called ahead they did nothing to prepare for our party of 16.

It took me the third time to realize TGI Fridays wasn't a primary restaurant for exceeding customer service. The first time, everything was exceptional and A-Ok. We had the Macaroni & Cheese filled balls which were so exquisitely delicious. The service was lovely at first and we ended in good terms. The last time I dined here they had a late night atmosphere, where they obviously had most of the tables closed, but the bar was remained open. We took a seat next to the bar and we ordered some steaks. Julie was our server but she hardly attended us. No refill on our drinks, it was horrendous. She only gave us our food and even left. My goodness we had to hunt her down. The steak gave us food poisoning and the next day we reported this to their high up manager. Although we received a gift card, the service lacked justice. I sure felt awful coming in.

TGIF is 1 of my favorite places to go in West Covina, CA, but this location is below average. Service is a thing of the past. My glass is empty for a while and 2 bartenders are 7 feet away and chatting it up. Guess they don't want tips. Not impressed.

First time being here yesterday night the place is pretty cool lots of energy the wait wasn't long it was 6 of us and me and my guy friends went out for a smoke by the time we got in our girlfriends/wifes were already mad are waitress was being rude to them it wasn't hard to miss her covered in tattoos glasses looked Asian horrible horrible service checked on us maybe 3 times are drinks went low we were charged extra won't be coming back to this location

This location has decent food but the service was unbelievably slow.....an hour after we ordered we finally asked if there was a problem and if so, we'd just go somewhere else. Miraculously our food came to the table right after that. This was a Sunday night and it was not busy at all. Our server was weird too. She'd come to our table and be the nicest, friendliness person and then the next time be rude and crass. It was very confusing. I left a 20+% tip, although we won't be back.
Typical TGIF - except the Broc was rubbery, mashed potato had a feel like it was in the pot a long time and the chicken tastes frozen thawed and refrozen too many times.
My boyfriend and I love this place, food is great and so is the customer service. Nakima is the coolest, we love her .

For a place themed "Friday" it's probably the worst day to go. Host sat us at dirty table that took 20 minutes to buss. Waitress was so unpleasant it was disgusting. Food took over an hour to get to our table. Complained to manager and he didn't seem to care one bit. Long story short, they lost our business.

You've got to be kidding me. Walked in at 7:20 pm and sat down immediately. It took our waitress 5 minutes to take our drink order, and another 10 minutes to get the drinks. After we order our food, it took 45 minutes before I had to flag down another server and ask where our food was. The manager comes over and asks how long we had been waiting for our food. Seriously, you're the manager, you should know. The restaurant was only half full. If you can't keep track of your workers and food times maybe you should install a digital clock to tell you how long an order has been waiting. After I explained the situation to the manager the food starts to come out. I tell the manager we no longer want the food, as my family has already walked out, and all he can say is sorry. He offers to comp the meal and I declined. I asked for the bill but it's only right we had a few drinks ($12). He tells the waitress to get our bill and she decides to walk to another table and start talking. Again, seriously!!! Now the bill was $12.60 total. I give her a $20 bill expecting to get $7.40 back. I went to public school but I think I got the math right. This reject brings me $6 and runs off. Wow, I guess she knew she wasn't getting a tip and decided to take her own. I call that theft TGIF. So keep the money and keep the food. As a disabled Vet, Five Guy's Burgers took care of us. You get 1 star because Yelp still won't allow negative stars. Keep your money folks and go across the street.
This place is trash stay away unless you like waiting for service I have seen more of the cook than our server
Stopped by after work to have a quick drink Alexandra recommended a few items. I was very pleased with the results. Definitely will be coming back. Alex did a great job

I have to say, for a chain restaurant, one wouldn't know it. The customer service, friendliness and overall feeling of home quickly erased those thoughts! If you go to the one here in NorthField and if Mia is working, you will not be disappointed!! She absolutely Rocks!! And that's all before getting the food too.. The Cajun Chicken and Shrimp, one of my favorites, and it didn't disappoint either! The ribs, meat falls right off the bones, the truffle hamburger, yep, it didn't make it in a box to go, it was done before it even hit the table!! The ribeye, cooked to perfection, have to say I sneaked a small piece off of my sons plate!! And if I hadn't mentioned already, sit in Mia's section!! Have a great time & enjoy your meal!!
Worst service, no silverware, cold food, out of food, endless appetizers didn't make it out, brought opened bottles and used champagne/warm,

Very slow service, burned burgers, told waiter we would be ordering a salad with salad to go later when we placed our main order.  When we went to place it he told us they were out of salmon and had been for at least a couple hours.  With at least a dozen other good places to eat around Northfield, don't bother with this place.

Of all the TGI Friday's I've been to over the year, the people here are probably the coolest and friendliest. Late night at the bar here is the most fun I've had in a long while. Cindy is absolutely hilarious! Kelly came over and made sure we were all doing good, and we certainly had no complaints. Good drinks, good people, and good consistent food as can be expected from an established chain.

Stopped here after leaving the airport.  Wish we hadnt because it was beyond disappointing.  First let me say that the staff was very friendly and our waitress was great.  However the food was disgusting we thought maybe the cooks were new but even that is no excuse for what was on our plates. I wanted the new stacked burger and the waitress suggested the truffle burger.  I wanted it mid rare but they only cook their burgers medium here.  It was burnt and I had trouble chewing on it.  My kids refused to share it with me and opted to eat only fries because my husbands Jack Daniel's chicken sandwich was equally as well done and they forgot the sauce.  Evidently this is also how they cook it according to the waitress they pour the sauce over the top.  Not true but whatever couldnt eat it anyway.  Needless to say we wont be back and if this is any indication of how the burgers are meant to be cooked we wont visit another Fridays either.  I posted a pic if my burger.

I like this place. It's close by, the food is good and the ambience is fun. I guess the only bad thing about this place (not really their fault) is that it gets crowded and the noise level gets a little bit annoying. Other than that, I would recommend this place.
I had a great experience at this TGIF, Nakima was our server and she was super friendly and helped us with whatever we needed. Definitely will be returning!

My experience is that the staff and atmosphere of a restaurant contribute to the star ratings (assuming the food is par with expectation). As such, though TGI FRIDAYS  is a chain and I would be reluctant to rate them, the several times I've  been here (in the bar area specifically), the staff, waiters and bartenders have always exceeded expectations. Most likely, besides the Jack Daniels grill menu, that's why I keep coming back. Off topic, I am a fan of the happy hour and pot stickers.

Waitress was the sweetest lady her name was Jennifer. She was helpful and very apologetic for the 35 min delay on our burgers. We order the all American stacker burger and the classic cheese burger. American stacker burger was the grosses thing I've ever ate in my life. Definitely could tell it sat in the window for a while. They half ass put the hamburger together and it nearly slid off the place when another waiter say it down in front of us. The thousand island dressing in between the hamburgers looked like cottage cheese and smelled like my grandmas feet. Bad bad food!

Being the Yelper I am, I normally hate chain restaurants. However, in meeting a few coworkers here to discuss some upcoming events and projects, I was pleasently surprised by the following things: 1. The NEW menu items. The table sampled everything from the ahi tuni crisps & new steak skewers to the thai steak salad and the veggie dagwood (amazzzzzing!), and we loved every bite of it. It makes all the difference that they have changed up their menu :) 2. The attentitive staff. Our waitress was constantly refilling our waters (a huuuuge plus!) and helped us narrow down our decision of what to try by giving us her opinion and favorites. 3.The drinks. yummmmmm. that's all i can say :) 4. The overall atmosphere and vibe Friday's gives off now. Eye catching decor, fun artwork, jammin tunes and a revamped space, makes it much more appealing to me! Overall, awesome experience, and i WILL be back to get to those yummy new things i didn't have the belly room to try! :)

Absolutely terrible!! I signed up for yelp just to express my displeasure of my experience.  Burger was nasty, fries cold, ordered an appetizer and main course came out first, never saw the apps!!! Would not recommend this place to cater Colorado's supermax!!!

I used to spend weekend nights at Friday's ever week when I was in high school (in the 90's)I suppose there must be a reason that in the past two years I've been to  Friday five times or less and after today I can say I will never be coming back.  Every time I've been here I have been less than impressed and today was the straw that broke the camels back. Walking into the restaurant was challenging because of the giant group that was seated at the front. I had to squeeze through and I am average sized and I still bumped into both chairs on either side of me. To me this is annoying and a huge safety issue if there were to be a problem inside it is single file lines out of the dining area. Yikes.  We get seated and I take a seat in a chair with my back to the "aisle" and within the first 5 minutes of sitting there my chair has been jostled no less then 10 times by people trying to get in and out. Absurd.  Service was the slowest thing ever. A freaking turtle could have brought me my beverage (sodas and iced teas at our table, nothing from the bar) 10 minutes is about 8 minutes too slow.  We all order the lunch special (unlimited soup, salad and bread sticks) Unlimited sounds nice, I usually like to indulge in two bowls of soup (gasp! I know) However we sat around at our table after finally ordering our food and we never saw our server again. It took at least 20 minutes to get said soups and salads to our table and then at least 10 minutes to finally track down our server to get our bill. Which of course turned out to be wrong because we got charged for drinks.  We were here for over an hour and had a bowl of soup and salad. I could have gone to Panera and had a much more enjoyable experience.  Goodbye Fridays, we're officially broken up. Forever.
The service was great but a couple of dishes and drinks came out under par I would not recommend this one
Horrible service during lunch hours. its not really busy at all.  I've been waiting for over 40 minutes and still have not received my appetizer.

Visiting the area and it was snowing. I was not really looking forward to visiting a TGI Friday but was very pleasantly surprised. We chose the restaurant because it was located across the street from the meeting location and we could walk there. The staff was great and the food was better than expected. The wait crew was happy to substitute salmon for the chicken on the menu and it was really good.

Quick one, star review... I and a few friends stopped in for "all you can eat soup and salad lunch" it sounded   okay when my friends suggested it, we were not real hungry and wanted to eat light but healthy. I ordered chicken tortilla soup with Caesar salad, the soup was thick, very thick, and tasted of tomatoes with soggy tortilla chips on top, unappealing in the extreme, salad was nothing but chopped romaine and a few halved cherry tomatoes, a couple slices of some mystery cheese with hint of salad dressing.  I could not taste the dressing there was so little of it, I thought they sprayed it on the lettuce, between the sludge they called soup and the boooooooring salad with no tatse of Caesar dressing I must rate this meal as a fail. Waiter was fine, food sucked

The food was okay, but why do I have to wait well over 40 minutes to get my order? Are you kidding me! I've never waited over 40 minutes just to get an appetizer, but apparently I did just for the first time during the 2-5o'clock on a Saturday.

Some may look upon reviewing a chain restaurant as taboo. Nonsense. I've been consistently pleased with this TGI Friday's. It's very affordable and we've had good food on every visit. It's convenient to stop by on the way to a movie at Harkins in the same shopping center. I love their jack daniels offerings (I mean seriously, everything is covered in a delicious sugary sauce). The JD burger is great and less than $10.  My girlfriend orders their chicken and steak dishes and again they're very affordable and taste pretty damn good. They also have no problem doing substitutions. Less potatoes and more veggies!
Horrible service.  Filthy  glass. Told the manager. No apologies or comped  meal/drinks

This TGIFridays is fairly good.  The staff is attentive and the food is...well...chain restaurant food.  Not bad, but also nothing special. Last night was extremely loud, which really made it difficult to even have a conversation with the friends I was with.  Everyting we said had to be yelled across the table. Apparently they were having a trivia night in the bar area, while we were in the dining area.  The announcer and the music were so loud that I really did leave there with my ears ringing. Overall, it's an ok place that is open late, even during the week, so if you're looking for a place to hang that won't kick you out at 10pm, and you don't mind the noise (or you like trivia night), this would be a great choice for you.

OMG!!!  thats all I got to say... So a basic Fridays I'd give 3 stars.  This one in particular I give 5 for oh so many reasons. The food was SO great and filling.  I spent less then $10 on a burger that I couldn't finish it if I tried.   The service I received I can honestly say was the best that I've ever got in Denver.  I don't remember my servers name, but he was on-top of his game and very helpful and quick with everything...  I am for sure going to come back in.

Took my girls here for dinner before our movie...and wow. Terrible. Underwhelmed by the food.  C had the Thai Steak over a noodle salad and gave me a taste, talk about low quality meat....gristle anyone? The sauce was good. I had the parm encrusted chicken, it came with pasta in a spinach-alfredo sauce, well, about a half -teaspoon of sauce. The chicken filet was tiny and stringy. The bruchetta salad was nice. The did manage to get A's chicken strips and french fries correct. This was the Northfield location. The movie however (Pitch Perfect) was awesome !

Great food. It is a little noisy and of course the day I went it was really windy outside, probably hard to find days where it isn't windy out here in western Kansas lol. Prompt service, attentive staff, and great tasting food what else is there to want from a restaurant. I love the Jack Daniels options, I actually prefer the steak but the burger is great for the price.

We went here after there was a long wait times at our original destination.  The hostess was great and set us up quickly with a table.  There was some confusion about who our server was, and I wish the guy who has taken our drink order had continued to serve us.  Unfortunately, that was not the case.  We waited nearly 10 min for drinks, and the rest of our meal was handled similarly.  We asked for any part of our kids meals as they were getting antsy, and our waitress told us it would be 9 minutes.  Not sure if she was joking because we had already waited a good 15 minutes after our appetizer!!!  Then, we were loading up to leave and we couldn't even get someone to bring our check.  We asked the hostess, and she was going to get the manager, but she didn't even know who the manager was!!! Needless to say, I completely understand why there was no wait!  At least the food was actually good.

I like the Jack Daniel's entrees and most of the menu. The server was very friendly - even when my husband was being a bit annoying. :P That said, the food was slow and the server did not seem to have a very good grasp of the menu.

I've been to this restaurant for meetings a bunch of times at lunch. My take: service is most times is good not great, the menu holds a wide variety of food items (wish they would bring back iconic items that made them famous from the 70's and 80's), and the lunch menu is less expensive (till 3pm), but I don't see a difference in the portion size. Happy hour here has a good selection of wines, beers and drinks at a discount, and also some good food items. Join the Stripes club. Points add up fast and then there's free food (they're generous). All in all, this place is good, easy to find, has plenty of parking, and is consistent.

Ok, if you are looking for EXCELLENT service when a restaurant is getting slammed, go to mc Donald's. Seriously people. This Fridays has been a favorite of mine for almost over a year now. I always get great service and great food. Pay attention people. If you're in a hurry go to mc Donald's and stop whining.
Good food reasonable price.  Constantly good customer service.  Not incredible but consistently good which is good.

The place was nice and clean and we were seated right away. The food was ok not great, especially for the price I paid. However I did not appreciate being rushed out as soon as I paid my bill. When they picked up the bill I was talking to my friend getting ready to leave and the waitress asked if" do you want your water to go?" Really?! Water to go!! They basically said leave now. Mind you this was a Sunday , around one in the afternoon. They did not have many patrons at all( maybe 10 people) and they ushered us out. I will never come back to this restaurant or chain again. Worst service ever. Avoid this establishment !!
Food was pretty darn good. Service was great...Slow which was nice because the server kept coming back.  My only issue was the grill cheese and tom soup was delicious but not enough grill cheese :(

My boyfriend was given a $25 gift card and we went to try it out. Right away someone talked to us and sat us very quickly . I honestly felt cramped , uncomfortable sitting in the booth. We ordered some cheese sticks, and they fell kinda flat. One cheese stick was completely hollow and had nothing inside. There wasn't enough sauce for everyone and they put parmesan cheese all over  the plate..weird . The kids ordered a chicken basket and my boyfriend ordered a hamburger. He requested medium and honestly, it was raw . He didn't finish it but I couldn't blame him, it was nasty. I ordered the parmasan chicken and was let down with the plate presentation and the portion size.  I basically felt I was served a chicken-style hamburger (granted a very flat hamburger) encrusted with crunchy breadcrumbs that had no flavor. The chicken wasn't overcooked but it did have a few nasty bits that I had to spit out . I had a cherry tomato side salad and I found a strawberry in it, guess that slipped by someone. I had a side of macaroni and cheese and it was ok, pretty much microwaved cheese on top of a basic macaroni . There was barely any in the dish though. When I looked at the kids baskets they seemed to have way more then my adult portioned dish. When we looked at the bill , roughly $35 I felt even with the 1/2 off appetizers things are way overpriced . Basically I felt $10 out of my pocket was well worth it, but will I make a return visit? No .. there are far too many other places I would much rather go.

Waitress:  (responding to my request for some ranch dressing to go with  the side order of broccoli I ordered)...  "Would you like it on the side, or for dipping?" Me:  "Yes."     The Cobb Salad was made w/ iceberg lettuce and perhaps 3 pieces of bacon BITS.  Friend's chix wrap was crap, kids mac & cheese did not appease.

I don't eat much at TGI Friday's but when I do, I am not disappointed ..YET anyway. Only thing that bugged me a little the last time I was there was that they offer To Go Orders but don't have a To Go Menu. So I asked if I could take a Menu out to the car for a second as the person I was with couldn't go in and they told me No. Do you think I'm going to steal your Menus? LOL Here's a simple fix - Get To Go Menu's! Otherwise, Ya get 4 stars! :) Edit to add: Oh yeah - And your Mobile Website sucks! Which is why I asked to use a Menu in the first place.  Might want to fix that.

I can't believe I'm writing this review since I'm far too much of a snob to admit eating at a massive national chain.  Never say never, right? My kids wanted to go to Friday's in Northfield for dinner last night...thank you television advertising.  After much deliberation of other alternatives the hubs and I gave in.  We were very pleasantly surprised at everything. The service was prompt, attentive and friendly on all fronts.  The place was busy but not overly loud.  While the menus at these places are overwhelming, we were all able to find something without too much brain damage.   Hubs had a bacon cheeseburger and fries.  The fries were great and the burger was cooked medium rare, just as ordered.  I had the Korean Steak Tacos which were actually excellent.  The steak was plentiful and tender and they were dressed with the perfect amount and combination of lettuce, cucumber and cilantro.  Even the rice on the side was good. We both had side salads, which were fine.  Nothing great but not bad either.  The kids both had chicken strips and fries.  First off, they were huge, enough for lunch today, and they were quite good.  Since that's all my kids tend to eat when we go out we consider ourselves chicken strip experts.  These were meaty with just the right amount of crispy coating. Our water glasses were topped off regularly and the kids lemonade's were as well.  The dessert the kids got was good too - dirt cups, or something like that.  We'll definitely add Friday's to our arsenal of family restaurants

The service was great, and the bathrooms are clean, but the food was just OK. I had Broccoli cheese soup and a side a fries. We had been doing some shopping and needed an adult beverage to help us through the rest of the crowds... the margs were $5 and really not that great. The total bill for the meals was a bit redonc...prices seem a bit steep for what you get. I've been to TGI's for happy hour before, and that is fine if you just stick to draft beers.

They still deserve only 1 star, but I did want to update my situation.   It's funny a few days after my Yelp post appeared the gift certificates the manager said he'd said magically appeared in the mail!  Of course now I realize that they're only good at TGI Fridays....and not on alcohol---bummer, don't know what we'll be able to stomach here, maybe I'll donate them to the next panhandler I see!

So I've only eaten at a Friday's once before, but they haven't failed me yet.  Our waitress (kudos to Lauren) was really awesome.  Not only was she attentive (in just the right amounts), but she was genuinely happy.  That means a lot to me because I know how hard it is to plaster a smile on your face after a long day.  My favorite part of the whole night was that she didn't interrupt a single conversation I was having with my boyfriend to ask how everything was.  Yeah, the restaurant was slow, but I appreciated that she took the time to help us when we actually needed it. The food was really, really good.  The disgustingly awesome cheesy bacon cheeseburger (forgive me if I got the name wrong) was like Heaven for me.  The drink I had was great too and I guess our only complaint was that the b/f's Sam Adams didn't have enough head on it.   It didn't really matter, but in response to someone else's review, I didn't find the music to be too loud at all.  Maybe they jack it up when the restaurant is more full?  All in all, we'll be back.
Awesome menu! Has several selections that are not offered at other TGIFridays...a must eat place!

Vistied this store on 10/30/12 12:30 during lunch with my dad ( he visits 1-2x a week). We were sat by the kitchen, so we could hear every word the servers and people on the line were saying. Our server was Heather, who was extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful. The food we ordered came fairly quickly, and my ribeye was cooked a perfect temp. With that being said, my problems came from ordering one of their slushy drinks, and recieving a small black bar straw that made it impossible to drink this particular drink. When I asked the female bartender if they had any normal sized straws and she looks at me like im crazy and simply says "no" I again asked her If they had any restaurant sized drinking straws to drink this with, again, the answer was simply no. Sorry. Now my problem was with her attitude, her lack of caring or sympathy for my problem, and her apparent lack of respect for me as a customer. No "yes sir, no sir" was used,  she talked as though I was annoying her and she couldnt be "bothered" by a customer since she was so "busy" talking to the male bartender and taking care of her empty bar. (Apparently she doesn't realize the turnover rates of rude bartenders) I said ok, walked over to the fast food place, and got a bigger straw.  Why is it that most kids working at restaurants these days have zero manners, no respect for customers, and look like they would rather be anywhere but at work. Find more servers/bartenders like heather, and I might go back
You must try the triple berry mojito! Delicious!!! TGI Friday's has a great selection of food, great atmosphere and it's the perfect spot for a group happy hour!

I wouldn't tell you to never grace the doorway of this place, but I would strongly suggest you use it only as a last resort. A very, very last resort. If I didn't have a few friends who work there, I would have given the place one star. However, we all have our loyalties. No, you know what? Screw the pity star. We've downgraded to one. That's right. I went there. My personal experience(s) eating at the Northfield Friday's has been not so good. Slow service, food not cooked to order, and even my attempt at getting to-go food resulted in having to wait an inordinately long time before a waitress found the time to jot down that I wanted a sandwich and fries. And when I did get my food? Yeah, cold fries and no ranch on the side like I'd asked. They're a national chain. They should know better.  So, if you find yourself up at Northfield Stapleton and you're hungry and eating on a budget, skip Friday's and go to Heidi's Deli or Qdoba or hell, the food place in Target. You'll save yourself some time and probably get food that's warmer.

Never Again! Don't get me wrong service was fine but the food sucked. My son and I decided to go after not having been to Fridays in about a year. The last time we were there the food was way over priced and bland.  Well it was the same this time prices were better but food was bland. My son had a triple decker burger of some sort he said that the patties were the size of a McDonald's burger and even though he ordered them rare they came out hockey pucks. I had the parm chicken. It tasted boring. My son tried it and said it tasted like an old tire.  The mac and cheese was equally as bad. I poured salt on it to get some flavor. My son is very sensitive to salt and he tried it and said he didn't believe I had put any on it. We did have desert the Oreo cookie which was fairly good but came out with freezer burn on one side. The place hasn't changed much bad tasteless food. I think they lowered their prices cause it wasn't horribly expensive like the last time. Guess they are trying to lure people back.

Since having kids who were difficult at restaurants, I have not been able to try the "new" TGIF's.   That has all changed recently.  Date nights and a recent trip with the 3 and 6 yo have been pleasant! About the restaurant.  If you did not know, it is standard American fare.  Burgers, steaks, pasta, salads, wings, some seafood.  The bottom line?  Food is good.  Not gourmet, but really, really edible and tasty. We've tried the following recently, and here are my takes: BBQ sliders - ***** (AWESOME) Flat iron steak - *** (average) Chicken and Shrimp Pasta - *** (average) House Salad - *** (average) Breadsick (with salad) - **** (really good; piping hot) Kid's pizza - **** (surprised!  similar to Red Baron mini frozen pizza's; tasty with crispy crust; much much better than Red Robin pizza) Kid's Mac-n-cheese - **** Service - **** The atmosphere was good also.  Sat in bar and at table.  The atmosphere was loud, but for a "bar and grill", it's standard.  While not a sports bar, I could see catching a game here.

I gotta say, TGI Friday's sucks balls.  It always seems like a good idea, but then I go there and realize that it still sucks and it always will.   We had a gift card for some free apps, so we figured that it might be good for a post-shopping bite to eat.  We were there during happy hour, so we sat at the bar.  I do have to give credit to Fridays, they do have pretty good happy hour prices, so they get an extra star for that.  The music was BLARING and I could not hear my fiance sitting right next to me, I was constantly saying "what?" over and over again and that seriously got old real quick.   I ordered from their "right bites" (or something like that) menu.  I think they are supposed to be modeled after small plates.  The food was decent, actually it was better than my previous visits.  It was the service (or lack there of) that really ruined the trip for us.  When we finally got the bill, we put our credit cards out and then waited, and waited and waited some more for someone to run them.  Mind you, we were sitting AT THE BAR.  Where there is  BARTENDER who is always (supposedly) there.  The bartender either never noticed our cards sitting there or didn't care.  Finally I had to ask her to take it (after at least 25 minutes).  In the meantime, some poor dude sitting at a table behind us had to walk up to the bar and ask for a server since they had been waiting forever.  This was on a Sunday afternoon between 4 and 5:30, not exactly prime time.  No excuse.  Plus it seemed like they were well staffed.  Lame. Don't ever go to this Friday's if you're in any sort of hurry.  Expect crappy service and mediocre food at best.  I'm with Kat A., go to the Target food place and you are guaranteed to have a better time.

Food was ok, my daughter and I had the Friday's Light Cosmo Cooler, waitress was ok but the bartender and the manager sucked! Sat for an hour waiting for them to change a football game, they were to busy and then oh sorry there are two guys sitting at the end of the bar watching that TV! Rude!

Its not worth it, even on Fridays! We stopped in on Saturday night for a drink and some apps.  The drinks took 15 minutes to come out.  The potato skins were more like deep fried bread.  The chees on them wasn't even melted, you could see the square shape the frozen cheese was in.  The Pretzel stix were dry and burnt and she cheese that came with it was ice cold.  I was weary about going here in the first place. Now i know it was not worth it.  Especially with a ticket of $48.

Not only did it take 45 minutes to get our food, the wrong food delivered twice.  I had started eating fries when I realized it was wrong and waitress proceeded to bring me the right food (even though I told her I had eaten some fries) and took the plate I had, to the next table over and served it.

Most recent visit (today) is up there on my top 5 worst customer service experiences I've ever had, let alone at a restaurant. You would think on a Friday at lunch time, they would have staffed their A-team (God, I hope this wasn't their A-team), but it felt like their X, Y or Z team. My party showed up at 1:00pm, and was quickly seated, I was a little later arriving at about 1:10pm. When I sat down, my party (only 2 other adults besides me), had their water, and an appetizer came out shortly after. Great! Things were looking good. We all knew what we wanted pretty quickly after I got there, and made it obvious by setting our menus down and chatting with each other. 10 minutes later, nothing. So my friend told the waiter (who was at the computer directly behind us), "Hey, we are ready to order when you get a chance." The waiter, Christopher, said "okay, just give me a second to drop off these tickets at a couple tables." okay, no big deal, I get it.... he's busy. He then proceeded to chit chat with EVERY table in his section. Meanwhile, a manager comes by and asks every table around us how the service is.... but us. Okay, he'll be back, we'll talk to him them. We wait another 15 minutes, and he comes back to the computer and hears us say something about how I have to get back to work by 2, and he says "I haven't forgotten about you, I promise." He drops off ANOTHER ticket to a table, and comes back to get our order. I was a little short with him, as this is my lunch break, and I should be leaving to get back to work in 10-15 minutes.  Then we wait, and wait all the while he is chit chatting with all the other servers in a big group by the kitchen, the manager in there with them. Laughing, and not even checking for our order. My 15 minutes left on my lunch hour is gone by this point, and I pulled him aside (when he was just walking passed), and asked him to put my lunch in a to-go box and bring me the receipt, as I was already late. He says "k" and walks away. Then the food comes, but not my to go box for another 5 minutes. During those 5 minutes, NO ONE comes to see how the food is, if the orders are correct or even bring my party silverware. Unacceptable. I know you may be busy, but don't fool me into thinking you are too busy to show us even fair customer service, while you are chatting it up with every other table. Finally  get my food and as I'm walking away I hear someone from my party for dressing.... apparently that was forgotten too. So, now my food is in the fridge at work, meanwhile, I'm still hungry. TLDNR: Do not go on a lunch break if you have a strict time limit at your job. Order EVERYTHING you want at once (when you order your drinks) or you will end up waiting.

It's late and you're out and about; craving something good to eat or drink, you need to check out TGIF.  They have happy hour all day & night!  You heard me right!  All day and night, Subday -  Thursday.  They have drink specials and 1/2 priced full-sized appetizers too.  Definitely check out.

For a TGIF it was fine. I only go there with my bro who loves it, and I get the fries and pecan chicken salad - it is junk food heaven! My biggest problem is the staff is so loud and fake when they greet you. It's jarring (maybe its the fact that I lived in NYC 11 years).
Nikema was great! So genuine and attentive. Made us laugh the whole meal. Food tastes great. Only knocked one star cause it took the cooks a while to cook the entrees. Would come back.
My husband and I just filled us and our 4 teens with their  Endless Appetizers.  Very yummy!!!  And pleasantly surprised that the special was avail on a Friday night.
Super slow. Our server was very forgetful and chalked it up to one 12 top that sat when we did. Food was okay but took forever.
This was a great restaurant experience.  Our server, Nakima, was the best server I have had in a very long time.  Service was great and quick.  Food was great too!

We tried to eat there for lunch, we were never greeted. Completely ignored. My husband and I ended up leaving and went to a place we're we were promptly served. This guys are a total joke. We would not come to this place evere

I had a long day at work and didn't have a chance to eat all day so me and my sister decided to go to lunch here because I was craving the jack Daniels burger which I haven't had in years and it's amazing. We were sat right away and the hostess walked away then came back about 30 seconds later and asked for our drinks, so we thought maybe she wasn't the host and was going to be our server. We both got waters with lemon because it was 95+ degree day. We never got the lemons, so I asked again and the girl walked away. A couple minutes later another girl came up and offered to take our order, I ordered the small size of the potato skins and was even on the page for the miniature apps and pointed to it as well, then order my JD burger, I asked if I could have it Medium and she smiled and said yes. So then she leaves and it was about 10 minutes for our app, brought by someone else, we didn't have any silverware still, so I had to ask for that, then another 15 minutes go by and our burgers finally come brought by someone else again. They asked if we needed anything else and I asked for a box for the skins, and a refill on water since we haven't seen our waitress in the past 25 minutes. He takes our glasses, and I cut my burger in half and it is well done and dry as leather, I'm starving and didn't want to wait another 15 minutes for a new beef patty. So I finish one half of my burger and the guy still hasn't been back with our waters, ten minutes later or the box. Finally I see our waitress and say the guy never brought our waters back and she walks away without a word and brings us new waters with attitude as if we asked her to do 100 push ups. She never asked how anything was, and we just wanted to leave and I had to stop yet another person to get that box. Then I had to ask for the check. 5 minutes later I finally got it, and she had put the full size potato skins on the ticket and put my burger as "no pink" I thought it may have been the kitchen that just cooked it a little longer, but it was totally her fault, umm, excuse me, but medium has substantial pink to it. I asked her if she could switch the skins to the $4 ones and she acted surprised, Oh! You wanted the smaller ones?! So she just removed them. I gave her my card and a couple minutes go by and I finally got it back. It takes really bad bad service for me not to tip, but in this case I just couldn't. Our server practically didn't do anything for us. I shouldn't have to ask for everything twice, silverware, check, boxes, refills. Sorry but you earn your tip. I will be going to 120th if I want that burger again.

My friend and I were out and about and got hungry.  Since he's gluten-intolerant, it's difficult to find places with gluten-free options that don't charge an arm and a leg. The staff quickly got him a gluten-free menu to browse and with that, we were lured in.  The options for my friend to eat were more than just a salad and burger-sans the bun, which was a great change than what we're used to seeing.  The staff was very friendly from the beginning, so immediately, we fell in love. Today was also the big Bronco/Raider game so they were busy, however the staff was very calm and collected instead of rushing around. The prices weren't too bad, typical prices for a chain restaurant, $8.50-$16 depending on your meal. The portions that they give you are big, in my personal opinion.  I couldn't finish my meal, but the quality of it was very good.  The tomato and mozzarella is definitely recommended as a side. The dining area was very clean and the staff was very quick to clean when a table cleared.     I'm never in the Northfield/Stapleton area, but if I ever find myself near there, I'll definitely be stopping in for some lunch.
We went for my brother birthday on oct 22nd and it was great. Food was delicious, beer was super cold and staff is pretty cool. We had a great meal and not expendive at all

This was my first time eating here and hopefuly the last one. The food is "ok" but other than that, everything else sucks!  We got inside and were standing there for about 10 minutes untill the girl at the front noticed us, she was too busy reading something. Didn't even said "welcome" or anything. After that we waited for about 20 minutes to be called, finally my husband asked her what was going on. She didn't see our names in the list and apologized for not calling us. Great. She bring us to the table and we sit there looking at each other wondering if we will ever get a menu or something. Waitress came and ask what we were going to order... What?!?? If we have a menu maybe we can decide what to order!! She went ahead and grabed them. Her service was great, but the girl at the front door is bad. She looks like she's 17yrs, bad service and attitude. I'll never consider going back!

Against my boyfriend's disapproval and the fact that he feels Friday's sucks... we went before our movie.... Well let's say that Cindy the service bartender saved the day because our unfriendly, inattentive bartender (I think Deanna)  could have cared less about our experience.  Asked to change to a baseball game instead of the dodgeball on the screen and she kinda made a face and said I'll see... never did.   But seemed to have plenty of time to chit chat with employees and hang near bar regulars.... 4 GOLD STars for Cindy... friendly, attentive, and so helpful while she finished out her shift.  W would ONLY go again if we knew she was working!
Went for trivia night and it was great atmosphere. Enjoyed some drinks and endless apps which i ended up getting for free because my table got 2nd place in trivia and won $20 gift card

The customer service here sucks. Chick fil a service is way better than this place. We were seated immediately and asked what we wanted to drink. It took 15 mins before our sever noticed we were here (wasn't busy either) and then asked if she could get is something to drink.  She took our order Andy boyfriend asked for no tomatoes on his sandwich. When we finally got our order it was dropped off with no eye contact and server walked away. The sandwich didn't actually have a full tomato on it but there was juice and seeds. Assuming they put tomato on it and then just removed it. Too late the juice is now on the sandwich. In the 45 mins we were there we received one refill of our drinks.  Not once was eye contact made.  Wouldn't go back even if my meal was free.
Can't wait ten minutes for a menu.  I'll walk next door to the taco joint.  Man's gotta eat.

The service was decent but the food was just terrible. We won't be returning, ever. The meal left a lot to be desired, my chicken was overlooked and my so's dinner was undercooked. His cheese sticks came out cold in the middle. My chicken was tough and stringy. We considered leaving half way through the meal. We would have had a better meal at the purina factory down the road. Over all dinner was just very disappointing.
